abstract: Shell said problems in Nigeria and North America weakened its second-quarter results, and Exxon was hurt by lower margins and reduced volumes at its refineries.
snippet: Shell said problems in Nigeria and North America weakened its second-quarter results, and Exxon was hurt by lower margins and reduced volumes at its refineries.
lead_paragraph: Royal Dutch Shell, continuing to struggle with its operations in Nigeria and North America, on Thursday announced earnings that fell below analysts’ forecasts, and Exxon Mobil, the largest American oil producer, posted a 57 percent year-over-year earnings decline.

headline.main: Earnings at Shell and Exxon Fall Sharply in 2nd Quarter
headline.print_headline: Earnings at Shell and Exxon Fall Sharply in 2nd Quarter
